sentences.en: Our dean is an understanding counselor, not a martinet.
sentences.cn: 我们的教务长是一位善解人意的好顾问, 而非厉行严格纪律者.

sentences.en: The woman in charge was a martinet who treated us like children.
sentences.cn: 那管事的女人严格执行纪律，拿我们当孩子对待。

sentences.en: They discover that the new teacher is a martinet.
sentences.cn: 他们发现新来的老师非常严格.

sentences.en: Thomson , A . J . and A . V. Martinet . 1986 . A Practical English Grammar. Oxford University Press.
sentences.cn: 全建强: 《高级英语语法详解》,安徽教育出版社,2001年.

trans.tran_en: someone who is very strict and makes people obey rules exactly
